Karwar-Goa Kali Bridge Collapses; One Injured After Lorry Falls into River

The 40-year-old bridge is said to have collapsed at around 1 am. Three portions of the bridge collapsed simultaneously.

A bridge connecting Karwar and Goa over the Kali river collapsed in the early hours of Tuesday, with a lorry falling into the river. According to initial reports, one person was injured in the incident.

The incident occurred around 1 am when three portions of the 40-year-old bridge suddenly collapsed. The bridge, which is a crucial link between Karwar in Karnataka and Goa, has been a critical transportation route for the region.

Preliminary information suggests that a lorry was on the bridge at the time of the collapse, and the vehicle fell into the river. Rescue operations were immediately initiated to help the injured and to assess the extent of the damage.

Local authorities and emergency services have been alerted and are currently responding to the incident. The exact cause of the bridge collapse is yet to be determined, and investigations are underway.

The incident highlights potential infrastructure challenges in the region and raises questions about the maintenance and structural integrity of aging bridges.
title: A bridge, built across the Kali river collapsed near Kodibag, Karwar, in the early hours of Wednesday. The incident resulted in heavy traffic jams along National Highway 66, between Karnataka and Goa.
